Dear Roman John Kolodchin:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
09/12/2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective
action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
A six-month provisional license is recommended. Please complete form CWL-4617 to
inform the department if you wish to contest the issuance of provisional license or not.
Even if you contest the issuance of a provisional license, you must still submit an
acceptable corrective action plan.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.

Sincerely,
Cassandra Thomas, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CCI Rule 400.4108 Financing and audit
(1) A licensee shall do all of the following:
(a) Obtain an annual audit of all financial accounts.
Audits for nongovernmental institutions shall be
conducted by an independent certified public
accountant who is not administratively related to
the agency.
The agency has failed to complete a financial audit for the 2022 and 2023 fiscal
years.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
During the last reporting period, the agency had one special investigation that
resulted in non-compliance and a corrective action plan relative to providing
outdoor recreation to the youth and failure to complete variable interval bed checks
as required by policy. At the writing of this report, the CAP is pending. The Chief
3

Administrator has indicated the agencies intention to comply with the approved
action steps of the CAP to achieve compliance.
Financial Overview
The agency has not had financial audits completed for 2022 or 2023. At this time
the financial compliance and financial stability of the agency cannot be verified. In
addition, the agency has previously failed to provide adequate documentation to
confirm financial stability of the agency. In April 2023, the agency was issued a
second provisional license due to non-compliance with policy requirements to
complete and submit financial audits. The agency has failed to provide
documentation of annual financial audit completion since that time.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator Assessment was received and reviewed on 09/12/2024.
Assessment indicates there were not any barriers or systemic factors impacting
rule compliance during the reporting period. Safehaus staff continues to work
toward enhancing treatment for youth in the program. The agency staff and youth
both discuss the benefit incorporating outdoor recreation to their program has been.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff report being supported and valued by administration and parents.
Youth report feeling safe, secure, and benefiting from the program.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency was found to be well maintained. The facility is clean and organized
and programming being implemented.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the status of the license is modified to 1st Provisional.
